name: African Violet
depth:
African Violet plants in 2 inch pots.

African Violets with beautiful dark green leaves with red-purple undersides. They produce violet-blue flowers.

Light: moderate to bright, indirect light

Allow soil around roots to dry out before watering to encourage blooming. Avoid getting water on the leaves as this can cause spotting damage - consider watering from the bottom up.

Fertilize half strength every 2 weeks, or use a 'constant feed' method.

African Violets bloom best when they are pot bound. Pot diameter should be 1/3 the spread of the leaf span. Repot every 1-2 years but not necessarily in a larger pot.

name: Crassula perforata
depth:
Crassula perforata, also known as String of Buttons, in 2 inch pots.

Fast growing succulent with stems and leaves that appear stacked on top of each other. Stems grow upright at first and then hang down over time.

Light: full sun or light shade.

Drought tolerant. Water every 7-10 days in the summer, less often in winter. Allow top inch of soil to dry between waterings.
